Question
========
In a regression analysis, you can express the effect of X on Y in the 'normal' (unstandardized) b-coefficient and in the standardized b-coefficient ('Beta').  
  
What is the best description of the meaning of the standardized b-coefficient ('Beta')?  
  
The standardized b-coefficient ('Beta') indicates...

Answerlist
----------
* How much the value of Y changes, expressed in standard deviations of Y, when X increases by one standard deviation.
* What is the mean value of Y, when X has the value 0.
* How much the value of Y changes, when X increases by one, while the inverse influence of Y on X is held constant.
* How much the value of Y changes, expressed on a scale running from 0 to 1, when X increases from 0 to 1.
